title: Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69
medium:
(a)Orange, brick red and dark blue colored pencil on white tracing paper fastened to cardboard with four staples
(b)Blue and green colored pencil on white tracing paper fastened to cardboard with two staples
inscribed: Verso in graphite upper left corner: II - 22
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Tri-colored diamonds with white centers alternating with white diamonds with tri-colored centers. Two color ways on one mount

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69.
1952–69. (a)Orange, brick red and dark blue colored pencil on white tracing paper fastened to cardboard with four staples
(b)Blue and green colored pencil on white tracing paper fastened to cardboard with two staples. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-440.
